Author: brett
Content:
I really Joe Kraus' comment on this (I think from one of the previous startup schools):

"if you don't put your business model into beta along with [your product's beta], your feedback's totally skewed" - http://wiki.ycombinator.com/presentations/apr06/Joe_Kraus.mp3

Some stuff it doesn't make sense to try and charge the consumer for, but if you DO plan on charging them, make sure you do it early to get a sense of feasibility.

Title: Xobni Blog Archive - Top Mistakes in Year One

Author: pg
Content: Yes, I agree with you there.  Never estimate what hackers can do.

Author: pg
Content:
Yes, few professional investors would be interested. No matter what they claim about wanting to build long-lasting companies, the structure of VC funds requires them to have exits.

Interestingly, though, you'd also be out of luck with a lot of potential employees. The more ambitious ones want options that might make them rich. Without any prospect of an exit, you lose all the hotshots to competitors who offer such a prospect. That's why big, private tech companies are so rare.
